caption: Great food with some unique flavors. We got the prix fix lunch for restaurant week. The burrata was fresh and left you wanting more. The arancini was well flavored with a hint of gorgonzola. In the entrees, we got the ravioli made in lemon butter which was definitely new and unique for me. The pizza alla norma was well made and I love alla norma.
Food was good, service was dreadful. Had to hunt down server for refill, no parmesan offered with dishes and he was too quick in leaving w/o asking. Will not go back!
An Wow experience! 🇮🇹 great produce, fresh, authentic 👍
Wonderful experience from start to finish, loved the food and the service! Must visit!
Italy is here......
Best place in Downtown Chicago to shop for Italian specialty items.  The coffee is still to-go only, but it is great coffee and the Latte is served hot like it should be.
i only tasted some of the  food and i did like some of it but i personally think if enjoy italian food then go here
Food and service was outstanding.
Everything you see is from Eataly! The Wine is an incredible Rosso, the bread and grapes are fresh and the burrata is to DIE for!

Eataly is a unique restaurant(s)/market(s) combination where you can buy the ingredients for the dishes you just ate. They have an extensive and at times exclusive selection of refined Italian products for purchase. The gotcha of Eataly is the massive and at times ridiculous markups on all their products including the produce that makes it more of a testament to capitalistic America than the humble Italy that it purports to be.

I love Eataly! The restaurant is amazing. The coffee bar is also amazing. The cannoli are to die for. All the food sold in the grocery store is amazing. There are European import products here that I can't find anywhere else. Every time I am in the area, I make sure to stop in.

Have been a customer for the monthly wine subscription for a year now. Since Spring 2020, they have not consistently shipped monthly wine boxes but continue to charge the credit card monthly. I have called the wine department 1-2 times a month since Spring 2020 to check in on why wine shipments have not been coming and there has been no consistent answer, other than a complete lack of customer service and retention.  I am disappointed. The wines they choose are quite good but the lack of communication and inability to understand, appreciate, and present a solution to a simple problem speaks volumes to the level of excellence provided. A monthly based subscription service should not require 1-2 separate phone calls a month to remind them to send a shipment out.  Over the course of a year, I have spoken with Jamie, Kaitlin, and Julian. I hope the passion the staff has for wine can translate over into customer service and providing solutions to simple problems
(Translated by Google) Very nice place, but expensive!  (Original) Muy agradable lugar, pero costoso!
The margerita pizza is fire. Tastes very authentic!

Wine, meats, cheese, pizza, more wine! Chocolate, cola! The cutest aprons and Caio Bella everything. 🇮🇹🍾🥂 A must visit whether local and looking for a gift or visiting for the weekend. Two levels - lots to look through.
Still working under the covid and has all the good stuff
we love the food and wine at Eataly!
They have excellent pizza and pasta.
This place is ok. I like coffee and ice cream here. Pizza and pasta are just ok. I can make better one at home
(Translated by Google) Excellent. The pastas are incredible! Portions could be larger.  (Original) Excelente. Las pastas son increibles! Podrian ser mas grandes las porciones.

I will probably be forced by Google to put a star rating but it pains me if I must. Ordered from their online store. Had shopped their store in Chicago so I knew there would be a premium price on items but the caviar (shipped fedex arrived at room temp and the remainder of the order took them 17 days to process and send. Eataly Vaffanculo!
Easy to navigate

VERY DISAPPOINTED. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE AMONG WAITERS AND THOSE IN RESTAURANT. HAD TO WAIT FOR ONE HOUR PLUS AND PEOPLE WHO CAME IN WITHOUT RESERVATIONS AS WE WERE WAITING SAT BEFORE US. TERRIBLE SERVICE FROM ONE LADY IN SPECIFIC WHO WAS RUDE AND NOT HELPFUL. Due to the orders in Chicago we had to sit outside but most ridiculously the heaters had no propane and we were freezing. In the end, this is not what we were expecting at this price range and comparing to how people rave about different locations and we will mot be coming back.
Pizza according to Mom s ITRI  standards good but a bit too raw wine was ok montepulciano

Always a great experience. I feel lucky to have an Eataly in Chicago. There is no other store/restaurant that has an equivalent authentic Italian grocery collection. I love their hazelnut spreads, gelatos, pastry section, meats, breads, basically everything lol. Do yourself a favor and pick a random unfamiliar item the next time you go, you’re apt to make yummy discoveries this way ;)
Cool place with a lot of specialty items from italy!
The best pizza in town,
The Burata and tomato is delicious service is a little tough during the pandemic but I’m glad they are open,  Heaters help a Litte
Best fresh Italian food around love this place
Food & service was great. Fun to walk around 2 floors

Ate there today. BEST MEATBALLS IVE EVER TASTED. Velvet was our server and she had an outstanding personality and did an amazing job making sure our dining experience was delicious and COVID safe ! For old country, AUTHENTIC Italian, eat here. For Italian American eats like alfredo and sausage etc, this is not your place. But I dare you to open up your mind because it was 10/10 here !
Truly italian taste
This is one of my FAVORITE stores in chicago, such a good spot for the unique ingredients for making authentic italian dishes. Love it!!

(Translated by Google) I have not tried in another place such an exquisite breakfast as here! All super fresh and impressively rich! I would go a thousand times more. I share with you part of what my breakfasts and desserts were during my visit to Chicago!  (Original) No he probado en otro lugar un desayuno tan exquisito como acá! Todo súper fresco e impresionantemente rico! Iría una y mil veces más. Les comparto parte de lo que fueron mis desayunos y postres en mi visita a Chicago!
Been there in 2018 and it is by far the best place for italian cuisine, will go there again when i get the chance to visit chicago, highly recommended 😀 😊
What a neat and interesting place! Had everything Italian that you could ever want! Yummm
Choices are very limited.

Everything in the store comes from Italy. They have an extensive wine selection. They have just as many cheeses and pasta variations. I wish they had more options for wine glasses, but you can't get everything. Staff was helpful. The food and wine available to consume in store was likewise pleasant.

This place is phenomenal and has pretty much every type of Italian food product you can possibly think of.  Their cheese and deli department is absolutely spectacular, and their collection of Amaros and bitters is quite impressive, among many other things. Expect to pay premium price though, too.
Visited for the first time this past Friday and I'm pretty this place is what heaven will be like.
If I lived in Chicago, I'd probably be here every week or two. If you love Italy, or Italian food, this is the place to go - either grocery shopping or to dine (or grab take out in this COVID-era).
Eatly certainly won’t disappoint your need for fresh pasta partnered with one of the best Kale 🥬 Salads ever.  We found the service to be exceptional.  Save room for pastries and gelato 🍧!!
Just get the pistachio cannoli, it’s made fresh to order and is out of this world!
Time for this overpriced pos market to go bankrupt 😂😂😂
Two tiny pieces of bruschetta for 13$!! I was expecting big pieces but i got two small ones that are not enough for even one person. I felt like i have been scammed. I will never go back there again.
Nice friendly and good tastes
Great selection of Italian wines, friendly and competent staff.
Almost like being there! #italy
Great, authentic tasting pasta.
Great yearly sale going on, don't miss it!

Amazing experience. My family and I came expecting an amazing experience, and that is exactly what we got! The Service was amazing! Food was brought efficiently and our waiter was incredibly nice and answered all of our questions. The food was astounding! There were so many options! The appetizers were just the right size, not too big, and not to small The main course was outstanding in taste and appearance. Every single thing was out of the world. I would highly recommend you to come here

Please let people ordering pizza upstairs know that they must go to the ravioli station to pick up their pizza. I stood upstairs for about 20 minutes only to be told in a dismissive way pizza is always picked up downstairs.  Was a frequent customer of Eataly but after that last interaction I probably won’t be returning.
Fun to enjoy Italian products
I love ordering from Eataly on instacart. The personal shoppers are so attentive and give great suggestions for replacement items.
Great spot to visit for boutique cheeses, cured meats, and all the other amazing meats/pastas/etc. I stop by whenever I'm in town.
Service was great! Food not so much. I ordered a meat and cheese platter, literally that is what I got, thrown on a plate with a bit of honey.

We are all fighting covid-19 the best we can. Some of those fighting is right and some of them are wrong. Eataly does it wrong. Why? Because all the measures dont really help preventing spread of the germs. It does however prevent guest and visitor satisfaction.  I want to enjoy my doppio and my ice-cream. And as long as Im 6ft apart from the others I should be fine. However blocking so much space only creats crowds and people are easily getting crammed too close rather than 6ft apart.  Well, my doppio got cold and my ice-cream melted halfway through before I could start consuming it. Totally ruined experience, totally unnecessary.
One of the best places for Italian food in Chicago🍴
I love it here!!!!! Its so beautiful and everything is delicious. I promise the food here and the market place won't disappoint! I recommend trying the formaggio brioche.
Very nice and classy. Fresh everything you want! Friendly staff too.
What a beautiful store.The food is authentic and looks amazing. The way the store is set up is also very well done. I'm a fan of good food and therefore a fan of Early.
Great variety of products as well as prepared foods!

My husband and I came here while exploring Chicago, and thanks to Jason our experience here at Eatalay was fantastic. Not only was he super friendly, he was extremely pleasant to talk to, knowledgeable and kind but most of all: helpful. He truly made our day better. 5 stars to Jason!
I always love coming in here for the specials, the crew is always nice and helpful when making wine pairings when I need it, their selections of cheese is outstanding and hard to pass up.
I need this in London uk 🇬🇧 so bad thanks
Amazing slice of Italy, right here in Chicago! Great for browsing or actual shopping.
Fantastic food and authentic Italian goods for sale. A bit expensive, but it's definitely worth the trip.
At the moment it's possible to do some shopping and get some food. In fairness I don't think they thought through properly how to handle this crisis and the reopening.
Restaurant/ Supermarket/ Coffee Bar

(Translated by Google) For those who already know an Eataly unit what I can say is that the Eataly Chicago climate is worth it. The variety of seafood is also another differential.  For those who do not know Eataly is an international network of gastronomic centers focused on Italian cuisine. There you will find several restaurants, wine and cuisine classes, coffee shops and a plethora of Italian wines and products. It is an amusement park for those who like gastronomy.  (Original) Para quem já conhece alguma unidade do Eataly o que posso dizer é que o clima do Eataly Chicago vale a pena. A variedade de frutos do mar também é outro diferencial.  Para quem não conhece o Eataly é uma rede internacional de centros gastronômicos focada na culinária Italiana. Por lá você encontra diverssos restaurantes, aulas sobre vinhos e cozinha, cafeterias e uma infinidade de vinhos e produtos Italianos. É um parque de diversões para quem gosta de gastronomia.

I would probably give it a 3 out of 5 if it wasn’t for Harold who killed it for us. We were sat at 615 and while it was a short wait for water and bread we didn’t see a waiter until we asked for one. Harold killed it though. We were not sat in his area, he took us on and he was amazing. Thank you Harold for one is the best meals In Chicago.

I have a love/hate relationship with Eataly.  I love that it has so much Italian in one place, but I hate that it draws me to want to go back to Italy, every time I visit.  That gets a bit pricey. I used to love the allure of the small Italian/American deli's when I lived in Chicago, however they were not always easy to get to.  Eataly was a simple bus or el ride downtown.  The gelato was always perfect, the wines are great, the chocolate, charcuterie, pizza, and of course coffee. I miss you like I miss that one girl that broke my heart into a million pieces, but she was my first love and I can still remember our last time together.  Damn you Eataly.

(Translated by Google) Fabulous Go to Osteria del Mercato on the 2nd level and dare to try the market cuts and wine recommendations.  Definitely the best cut of my life, they are not cheap but they are worth every bite.  (Original) Fabulosoooooo Vayan a Osteria del mercato en el 2.º nivel y atrevanse a probar los cortes del mercado y las recomendaciones de vino.  Definitivamente el mejor corte de mi vida, no son baratos pero valen cada bocado.

Amazing place, so fun to browse around at all the things they offer. Great wine selections and their fresh produce looked wonderful. The restaurant upstairs is a great place for lunch. The service is always good and their pizzas are amazing!!
This place constantly delivers. They serve fresh food for convenient rates, there are no long waits even when the spot is full.

(Translated by Google) Positives: for me it is the best Eataly store in the world. It is large, well located, with parking, with many floors of products and food, everything is very traditional. Incredible options of drinks and typical Italian foods in addition to delicious restaurants. There's self check our too Negative points: it is not cheap (neither the food nor the products), there is no easy service for the products and I found the layout of the products confusing. You can even find products in 3 or 4 places in the store (for example, truffle products are at the entrance, on the second floor near the bathroom, next to the restaurant and near the checkout)  (Original) Pontos positivos: para mim é a melhor loja da Eataly do mundo. É grande, bem localizada, com estacionamento, com muitos andares de produtos e comidas, é tudo muito tradicional. Opções incríveis de bebidas e comidas típicas italianas além dos restaurantes deliciosos. Tem self check our também Pontos negativos: não é barato (nem a comida nem os produtos), não tem atendimento fácil para os produtos e achei a disposição dos produtos confusa. Mesmo produtos você encontra em 3 ou 4 lugares da loja (por exemplo, os produtos trufados estão na entrada, no segundo andar perto do banheiro, ao lado do restaurante e perto do caixa)
Beautiful place with good food. It’s a great fast paced atmosphere inside a large store on an upper level. We sat right at the kitchen and enjoyed watching chefs cook. Great experience.

This is a really unique place! I'm super happy I had the chance to eat here. I was able to find a vegan option and really enjoyed the ambiance. Wine was also a plus! Super cute, I only wish I wasn't just visiting. I would have loved to take some groceries home with me!

Eataly builds an Italian Empire. It has italian groceries, food, wines, spirits, olive oil, condiments, pasta, etc. It bakes its own pizza and bread in woodfire oven. It makes its own mozarella and burrata! It brews its own beer. It has cooking classes and three sections of restaurants (cafe, ice cream, desserts, pasta, pizza, meat, seafood, wine plus antipasti, etc). It sells books and kitchen wares as well. It has vege butcher. Last but not least, it helps protect the last supper painting by building a ventilation system in the chapel!! I could be here all day. You can even ask the restaurant to cook something u like from the grocery store. Twenty dollors up charge. Good value. Dry age meat available.
High end Italian grocery and food emporium

A not-to-miss stop for breakfast, lunch or dinner! Good real Italian food with so many different choices! High quality for food and drinks. And if you want to bring something back at home, have a look around in the shop!

I feel ashamed that I've lived in the city for three years and it wasn't until this moment that I ventured into this amazing location.  The food was spectacular, the options were limitless and the environment made it a total experience. My wife and I will certainly be back.
Very cool place I love the way it is laid out. You can decide what and where you’d like to eat once you get inside. There is tons to choose from, in here.
Plain and simple, one of the best espressos I've ever had in my life. (I'm from Australia, I'm Italian and I've ever been to Italy for 5 weeks)

What's there to say but simply all of Italy in one spot... From the moment you walk in the door you are transported to everything Italy . Your simply placed into sensory overload with all the wines,olive oils, and anything and everything Italian... They have a huge selection of fine cheeses as well and charcuterie that will make even the pickiest foodie happy. So we grabbed a glass of great wine and walked around filling our baskets... lastly we finished off with some food from one of the many stalls and life was bliss...

Absolutely love this place! I highly recommend the Tuscan kale salad and prosciutto pizza. Also, the service was impeccable! We were in a hurry and our waiter took the time to expedite our orders, which was much appreciated. Great wine selection as well. A must see if you are visiting Chicago.
Wonderful experience at Eataly. There is something there for everybody. I will come again the next time I’m in Chicago!

Awesome restaurant, cool decor, and lovely place for wine and pasta. Delicious food and great treats too. Also good gluten free options and best gluten free pizza ever! I totally recommend this place.
Love this place. Great food great drinks
A very nice place to visit and buy Italian goods. But the food doesn’t match the expectations. Had a chicken with salad and it is not reminiscent of Italy.
Selection of yogurt pesto bread fruits before they open at 10
Be very careful. They closed 20 minutes earlier. They are absolute morons.
I’ve been to Eataly in other cities and countries and love this locations. We had great service at the inside bar and love the selection of authentic Italian foods.
Love this place! Had a delicious truffle pasta while here during their truffle weekend

I wish I had more stars to give to this beyond amazing place. As of now it has over 3K reviews and I understand why.  Because: Huge first of all. Two floors. Extremely friendly service. With Market. Fresh: Fruits. Vegetables. Chocolates Gelatos Pizza. Made right there in front of you. Charcoal was cool! Pastas. All made from scratch. Bakery. Wiiiiiines!!! And many Other different drinks. Souvenir section. And so much more.  We had a prime rib sandwich with truffle oil It was to die for. The bread was fantastic but that meat was practically melting in my mouth with so much flavor plus that truffle oil made a huge impact. I wish I could have this everyday.  We all love this place so much!!
If you can score a table, you will leave happy. Tons of choices for every palate.
Great fresh pasta reasonable price ranges great wine selection

Extremely disappointed with the pizza here.  This is NOTHING like the authentic type of pizza in Italy.  The crust was oily, thick, and honestly tasted like Pizza Hut.  Thankfully the Mahi Mahi was delicious and perfectly cooked.  Our server was nice and professional.
Hard to get a table sometimes, but definitely worth the wait

A unique experience. Part market, part shops, part restaurants. We ate at a counter facing one of the open kitchens. Shared a pasta dish and Margherita pizza. Some crisp rose. The staff were friendly. It was fun watching the kitchen.

(Translated by Google) A place to enjoy all styles of Italian food in one place, pizzas, pasta, pastry, market, wines, a delight who knows it repeats .....  (Original) Un lugar para disfrutar todos los estilos de comida italiana en solo lugar, pizzas, pasta, pasteleria, mercado, vinos, todo una delicia quien lo conoce repite.....
Fantastic and fresh food, I liked the atmosphere this place has, and the staff members were very welcoming. Will definitely come back in the future.
(Translated by Google) Very good Cacio e Pepe  (Original) Very good Cacio e Pepe
Had a perfect time,  second time going,  still amazed me and my family.  Their first time!
I wish they'd serve a hot drinks

Amazing coffee and fresh pasta! It can be hard to find seats on busy days though. The only part that i would complain is the Gelato they have there is a little bit watery. Otherwise, the food is pretty good.

We made dinner reservation at osteria the day before Thanksgiving. When we got there our table was not made up and we waited about 20 minutes to be seated. Once we were seated the tables that were put together for our party of 6 were wobbly and of different heights. Our server was very friendly, but we had to ask a number of times for water refill and our order was incorrect when brought to the table. The food was excellent though. Maybe next time the service will match.
Excellent food, very busy but food, wine and groceries are terrific.
Good atmosphere and delicious food 😋

For everyone who like Italy and Italian food this is the place to be while in Chicago. It is centrally located in downtown Chicago just steps from Michigan avenue, close to Pizza Uno and Pizza Due. Eataly represents everything you can taste in Italia - from the famous pizza and pastas to the great Italian wine and espresso. The deserts are fantastic too! Go there for lunch and dinner and sign up when they have cooking classes too. You will not regret it.
A destination in Chicago

I'm from New York originally and used to frequent the Flatiron location. This was a whole new experience! I'd say there is a much larger selection in each department, more room to do your shopping! They also have a very impressive wine and alcohol selection here. The employees are very helpful and willing to help you track down what you're looking for. I've come back to eat at the pizza and pasta shop as well and the service was excellent (as well as the food). The gelato and coffee is also delicious.
Awesome, has restaurants, souvenirs and all things italian, My wife and I loved it

Tl;dr: Restaurant wait staff were very judgemental and no one could simply warm bread.  The workers in the restaurants upstairs appear to not care about doing their job. I was there on the late side for dinner, but not so late that there weren't a fair number of other people sitting and eating. First off, I walked up to one of the islands, something like "Osteria" and the cooks behind the glass panel were just having a loud conversation and completely obviously to me. There was no one else around so finally had to say "excuse me, do I just sit down?" And they said oh a server will come take care of me. So I pull out a chair and a server steps over. (Did I really need to signal by sitting down and they had no clue by me standing there and wandering around?) I already knew what I wanted, which was the pasta with beef cheek filling. I asked if I could swap the butter sauce for a red one. The server was like uhhh I mean we don't really do that, but I can assure you the butter sauce is flavorful enough if that's what you're worried about. I said I had been to Eataly in Los Angeles, and also had a very similar dish and they originally suggested to me I swap out for red sauce according to my preferences. Server still said oh I don't know about that but just left it as "well I gotta take the butter sauce". Literally how hard is it to swap a sauce at EATALY. I wasn't asking for a sauce with truffles. Any. Red. Sauce.  Bread came cold. And I mean fridge cold not room temp. At the other Eataly, it came heated just like nearly ever restaurant ever. No one was bothering to check in or even walking near my island. So had to wait until finally someone walked near enough to ask for my bread heated. This person said oh I don't know how to do that and promptly walked away. I assumed she was going to get someone else. nope, just walked away.  Flagged down another guy who also said he didn't know how to do that, but would go find his manager. By now I've finished my pasta. He doesn't come back for ages so I presume he forgot. I get up and walk to an island where my server is standing. Say that I've requested my bread be warmed but have been ignored. She looks at me as if I'm insane wanting my bread warmed and says sorry I don't know how to do that. Ok, i go back to my spot and the other guy comes back having asked his manager to take my bread and warm it. Then the server, she comes back with a bowl of different bread cut at odd angles saying oh I found this room temperature bread. I say, other guy took care of it and is warming it. She is surprised and astonishly says again oh welp I didn't know you could do that.  I should mention that all this time other servers and wait staff are just clumped together in random spots hooting and hollering, having loud conversations and not bothering to check on guests. I get it, there aren't that many customers around. But there were at least ten tables, so have some courtesy.  This Eataly location is truly upsetting and the service is really subpar. The fact that nobody knows how to warm bread is really sad. They made me feel like I was weird for requesting warm bread, and only one person went out of their way to figure it out. I am not a picky eater or confrontational person by any means. But even McDonald's knows how to serve warm bread.  At least the employees working in the chocolate department were nice, though mildly uninformed. One lady told me that it was $3 for a box of chocolates based off a sign. I literally questioned her multiple times as she pointed to different boxes saying oh I think this is the $3 box. She asked someone else who finally confirmed as I expected that $3 is just for the box, no chocolates.  Eataly is one of my favorite places in LA. This is just too bad.

Such an amazing atmosphere. Something for everyone. Lived that you can walk around and enjoy tasting different foods and drinks. Lots to shop for. Good quality items. Took me back to our time in Italy.

Upscale spot for something to eat already made, and for all of your pantry and food needs for making special meals at home.  Chances are more likely than not, that if you're making an Italian meal, whatever you want, they've got.  Also a fantastic selection of Italian wines, from table wine, to Barolo, Brunello di Montalcino, Amarone, whatever it is, if it is Italian, it most likely can be found there.  As I look at a few reviews of the place that downgrade it for petty reasons, I CAUTIONS readers, when you see bad reviews, and the reviewer has only done a few total reviews, have a look at their profile.  Chances are, no matter where they go, they either give FIVE STARS or ONE star.  And they seldom have much to say about why.  Eataly was a really great trip for me and my partner on our first time in Chicago where we got a suite with our own kitchen so we could make some meals ourselves.  Bought some excellent cheeses, charcuterie, and even a few top notch bottles of Italian wine for laying down.  It is pricey, but QUALITY doesn't come cheap.
Eataly Chicago is an amazing place! I enjoyed photographing the beautiful cuisine and lovely booths!👌

Overall we had just an okay experience. I still like giving places a shot even if they don’t have great reviews. Unfortunately, the reviews were right on this one. Food was good, but the overall experience and service was poor For a Tuesday night.. Drinks took way too long to get to the table. Appetizers were slow to the table as well. Ended up leaving and going elsewhere for the main course, more drinks, and dessert. Eataly’s loss. Won’t be recommending anytime soon.

We have visited 360 Chicago observatory desk. And the day was really windy. One of my friends suggested to get ciaccolata calda from Eataly. I have taken a medium with whipped cream on it. It just tasted perfect. I will recommend it to every chocolate lover. And even if you don't love chocolate I think you will love it. All the ingredients are mixed with perfect combination to make it. It is really mouthwatering and delicious.

One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago!!! Came in for a solo dinner and was seated immediately. Had such an attentive and kind waiter- Brian is awesome! Food was incredible as always. Could not have asked for a better dinner!!

We ordered pizza and pasta, and they were both delicious. It was authentic Italian. As much as we loved the food, I cannot stop thinking about the cannoli!! I want to go back with a sealable container and buy the filling!! Amazing!
(Translated by Google) The place is nice; very crowded  (Original) El lugar es agradable; muy concurrido.

I love this place!! Get a glass of wine and shop for a delicious meal or got out for a yummy meal. We went to the pasta place on the second floor in the middle...service was amazing and the food was outstanding. We tried the octopus starter and the cheese wrapped in prosciutto with sage and honey...amazing!! We also had two pastas...ravioli with sage and brown butter and a lamb ragu with mint. Both were delicious.  Love the dessert area downstairs...little pastries, crepes, cannolis, or gelato. Everything was perfect!

It’s a nice place to look around or buy oils and cheeses but it’s a HORRIBLE place to eat. DONT COME HERE TO HAVE DINNER. DONT! There’s always A LOT of people so you won’t find a place to eat. And if you make a reservation they will make you wait for a lot of time until you get your table. It’s a very frustrating and stressful atmosphere because there’s too many people. I’ve had the same expierence in Eataly in New York where my family even had to eat separated. Some in a restaurant some in another one DONT COME HERE. Very bad customer service and experience DONT COME HERE

If you are a fan of good food you have to come here. You will love it. Eataly Chicago is incredible. Supermarket on one hand and little restaurants on the other hand. You get everything your heart desires and you get it fresh! Fresh fish, fresh meat, cut from the big piece, dry aged meat, sooo many variations of cheese as well as fresh made but uncooked paste to take. Then again you find little bars where you can order cooked foods like sandwiches, pizza, pasta, antipasti and all kind of different wines and drinks.
Unlike anything I have ever seen; great fun, great food, great shopping.  A wonderful experience.
Authentic Italian grocery and restaurant
If you love waiting a long time for overpriced, mediocre food this is the place for you.

You will never find this in a small town. Great selection of true Italian goodies. If you love to cook, this is the place for you. Lots of legit olive oils, balsamic vinegars, cheese, and so on. I could literally spend my whole paycheck here.

A store definitely worth checking out if you're in the mood for anything Italian. Good selection of Italian products, meats, pastas and wines. If you don't feel like cooking just go ahead and eat out; they have a wide variety of dining options, from pizza to pasta and everything in between then finish up with a nice cappuccino or gelato. Very nice ambiance but it can get a bit busy and the restroom lines do tend to get a bit long.
Cute place to walk around and look at . Good wine shopping area . Food not good , service not good and small restrooms . Overall for the price and service a one star .

Food ok, expensive, service disastrous. Do not go there 1h before closing.  We went there (Sat 9:30 pm) and ordered appetiser and pasta. We did not get the food at the same time. We got the mains when we we still eating the Appetizer so they were cold wenn we have finished the starters. bread came just after we have almost finished the Appetizer. When the waiter placed the food on the table I told them, that we are still with our starters. He just replied that the kitchen will close soon. No further comments, nothing. Officially the kitchen was still 15 min and Eataly over one hour open. In general, the atmosphere was quite bad as all people were cleaning up quite loudly.  Was a bad experience, especially when you spend 50 bugs in 30 min for cold food.
(Translated by Google) Simple and fresh pasta was delicious!  (Original) 심플하고 신선한 파스타 맛있었어요 !
Amazing place for cheese lovers
Fun place to paruse!
Pretty unique experience in the city. Nice shopping and dining options. Restrooms could be more plentiful and clean. Great wine deals on Wednesday’s.
Love that place 🇮🇹🇮🇹

This is for La Pizza and La Pasta. From the beginning... 1. Water was spilled all over our arms/hands and menus 2. Olive oil was spilled all over the table 3. The waiter took 10 minutes to come and then all he said was "are we ready to order?" Then he seemed more concerned about whether we had any allergies to the food we ordered which...fine I guess, but I can see the ingredients and am not gonna order something I'm allergic to. 4. Our waters were never refilled even tho we finished them while eating the bread 5. Spaghetti was too salty and undercooked (yes I love al dente. It is undercooked if u can grind the grains while u are chewing). 6. We were obviously finished eating but we had to wave down the waiter to get our bill. 7. The waiter saw we had barely eaten our pastas so called the manager over. At this point we just wanted to leave, but told the manager about my pasta. It then took forever to actually get the bill delivered.  So we had both our pastas comp'd but it would have been much better to have a great experience and pay full price. This might sound nitpicky and honestly any one of these things individually wouldn't have been a big deal but when you add it all up, it actually really sucked. I think it's even worse cuz we have been to other Eatalys and pretty much always had a great time
Vibrant place with grocery store, coffee, pasta, panini and dessert. All 100% authentic Italian.

All you need Italian in one place. A delight to all the senses. Everything from hard to find olive oil, coffees, wine, etc. The upstairs is filled with food choices including a dry aged beef option. The downstairs is where you'll find all sorts of dolce. Affogatto is usually served in a small cup but not here, even that is americanized with a full serving of vanilla ice cream and a double espresso.  A good addition to the Chicago food scene. It could've done a better job in honoring the Italian immigrants that made Chicago home though.
Sabbia is pretty good. We ordered pasta and a dinner special with fish, green pepper and red pepper, they aren’t too spicy.
The best focaccia I have ever had. Do yourself a favor and try this place
Too pricy.i ordered pork shoulder plate with two sides ,which were kale and potatoes. Too salty and very little portion of pork cost $15. This place was not as good as NYC location. So disappointed.
The cornetto crema is always incredible!
Overall very good food and cosy place.

I really like what this place has to offer -- I'd give the food and drink options 5 stars -- but I have to downgrade for a few reasons. First, not enough restrooms (and poorly kept) given the size of the place and the amount of customers going through their doors. Surprising given that there is food everywhere but only 2 kinda nasty-ish restrooms on the first floor. Second, the food establishments close their kitchen long before the place officially closes, so take note if you're planning to come in for a late night bite. The hours posted are until 11pm, but some places close at 9 and the rest close by 10pm.
Desserts are to die for. Highly recommend the classic and pistachio cannolis.

I’m sorry but as a former employee I wouldn’t recommend this place for work it’s terrible & the managers are unprofessional & mainly so Alexis she oversees the QSR and she is a fake she doesn’t care for no one and she uses her friendship with a manger to get in the way of business and she takes advantage and works the crew like slaves and that isn’t right like don’t get me wrong great place to eat and chill but not work

Such a cool concept and yummy food! Perfect lazy sunday funday activity- whether family day or for a couple! Able to eat, drink and shop for your favorite Italian treats! The seafood squid ink pasta and eggplant penne was so yummy. Only thing i wish was that the bread they bring to table was warm or softer and that the oil to dip it in had black pepper, red flakes, or even parmesan!
Not as good as the one in NY.  Came here for a friends dinner. Dishes were good, but not exceptional.

I LOVE EATALY!!! It’s like the IKEA of Italian food. I always go hostess to the bar in the back and get a glass of rose and get the arancini (fried risotto balls with molten Parmesan and prosciutto inside or the one with fresh cheese and peas). Then I buy some fresh pasta and a great bottle of wine. They also have a really cool meat and cheese section and a few different restaurants inside that you can just walk up to, order food, and sit down at. Great spot to visit if you’re visiting from out of town.
Everything about this place was awesome!! Best pizza and wine I’ve had.
(Translated by Google) Very good and very nice, there is the same in Dubai  (Original) Très bien et très sympa, il y a le même à Dubaï
Awesome service and awesome food ! Should try the pasta and pizza here!
Loved it! Good food, well located, good people overall experience great
Very nice restaurant
